body:
Hi people! This is my first discussion here, so I want to talk about staff applications. I'm with lots of doubts and maybe the staff and the community here can take my doubts!
1st- A lot of staff told to me that staff applications are closed. Are they really closed? If they are closed, when they open again?
2nd-If staff applications are closed, when they re-open, the rules to staff applications will be the same as of January 2015 staff applications?
I will appreciate if someone tell me my doubts, cause i'm doing as much as possible to enter in the staff (if it's open, but if it isn't i will help in the server and in the forum.
Bye!!!

title: Staff applications!

replies.body: They are closed. Sometime in March they will open again, except this time we will trial hand picked staff as a new way to choose our staff members. If it fails, we will go back to applications after, if it succeeds, most likely hand picking staff will happen more when the time comes for us to get more staff.
replies.body_tagged: They are closed. Sometime in March they will open again, except this time we will trial hand picked staff as a new way to choose our staff members. If it fails, we will go back to applications after, if it succeeds, most likely hand picking staff will happen more when the time comes for us to get more staff.

replies.body: But the rules will still be the same?
replies.body_tagged: But the rules will still be the same?

replies.body: And handpicked like what, the senior mods see players that they like to be a mod or different way?
replies.body_tagged: And handpicked like what, the senior mods see players that they like to be a mod or different way?

replies.body: Handpicking is recommending players for staff, coming from Moderators and above. Staff applications have more of a "rules" section. So in March, you really just follow the server rules and anything else the staff team notices that you are doing good with, like behavior and attitude. Overall, the eligibility for players are the same as in applications, except the process is different. So the rules would technically be the same, for eligibility, just the end result would be a little different (doesn't affect the requirements that much).
